etymology.description: Depicts a luxuriant plant growing on the ground (土) -> modern version simplified, missing bottom stroke -> similar to top component of 豐(豐) (fēng, 'abundant') and 奉(奉) (fèng, 'offer')
etymology.interpretation: The character 丰(豐) (fēng, 'abundant') originated as a pictogram depicting a plant thriving on the ground, symbolizing abundance. Over time, the detailed strokes representing the soil and growth were removed, simplifying the character.

examples.english: This year's harvest is very abundant.

examples.chinese: 田里的庄稼长得十分丰(豐)，农民们笑逐颜开(農民們笑逐顏開)。
examples.pinyin: Tiánlǐ de zhuāngjià zhǎng de shífēn fēng, nóngmínmen xiào zhú yánkāi.
examples.english: The crops in the field grew very abundantly, and the farmers beamed with joy.

examples.chinese: 菜园里的番茄结得丰硕(豐碩)，老爷爷摘得满满当当(老爺爺摘得滿滿當當)。
examples.pinyin: Càiyuán lǐ de fānqié jié de fēngshuò, lǎo yéyé zhāi de mǎnmǎndāngdāng.
examples.english: The tomatoes in the vegetable garden bore abundant fruit, and the old man picked them in plenty.
